Package planning

Class csvfilereader

  • java.lang.Object
    • planning.csvfilereader
  • public class csvfilereader
extends java.lang.Object
    This parses csv files meeting the official UK standard for such files at https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/sites/default/files/docs/2013/01/csvfileformatspecif(ication.pdf

    Copyright (C) 2018 William Paul Cockshott This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      csvfilereader​(java.lang.String fn)
      creates the reader assigned to file fn but does not do any reading until parser is called

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int colcount​(pcsv p)
      return the number of columns in the spreadsheet
      pcsv getcell​(pcsv p, int row, int col)
      return the cell at position row,col in the spreadsheet, origin on top right is position 1,1
      java.lang.String[] getcolheaders​(pcsv p)
      extract the column headers
      double[][] getdatamatrix​(pcsv p)
      extract the data as matrix of doubles
      pcsv getline​(pcsv p, int row)
      return the cell at position row,col in the spreadsheet, origin on top right is position 1,1
      java.lang.String[] getrowheaders​(pcsv p)
      extract the rows headers
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      pcsv parsecsvfile()
      returns null for file that can not be opened, otherwise returns pointer to tree of csvcells.
      void printcsv​(java.io.PrintWriter f, pcsv p)
      print the parse tree out as a csv file
